lead_paragraph: Safety Tony Joiner became the eighth Florida player in the past nine months to get into legal trouble when he was arrested early yesterday and charged with felony burglary. Joiner, a senior captain, was arrested around 5 a.m. outside the fenced impound lot of a towing company, Gainesville police said. He was accused of pushing a heavy electric gate open to enter the lot in an attempt to retrieve his girlfriend’s car, a police report said.
